title: Top US politician Dan Johnson kills himself following Facebook post slamming 'judge and jury fake news' after being accused of raping his daughter's 17-year-old pal

body.sentence: A TOP politician killed himself after leaving a Facebook post slamming accusations that he raped his daughter's teenage friend.
Kentucky state representative Dan Johnson died of a single gunshot wound after stopping his car in a secluded part of Mount Washington, the coroner said.
Johnson, also the leader of the Heart of Fire Church, denied the accusations reported by the Kentucky Center for Investigative Reporting.
The story accused Johnson, a Republican who was a firm supporter of President Donald Trump, of having molested a member of his church.
The woman said she was aged 17 at the time of the alleged incident in the church basement.
She claimed Johnson crept into the room while she was sleeping beside his daughter and groped and penetrated her against her will.
Police had been searching for Johnson after someone read a post on his Facebook page and became concerned.
In the post, written on Wednesday, Johnson paid tribute to his family, saying he had suffered post-traumatic stress disorder for 16 years - "a sickness that will take my life".
He wrote: "The accusations from NPR are false GOD and only GOD knows the truth, nothing is the way they make it out to be.
AMERICA will not survive this type of judge and jury fake news."

At a press conference on Tuesday, Johnson linked the accusations to similar allegations against the Alabama Republican Roy Moore, who was defeated in a special Senate election that day, saying they were part of a nationwide strategy to defeat conser
Michael Skoler, president of Louisville Public Media, which owns the Kentucky Center for Investigative Reporting, told the Washington Post everyone at the organisation is "deeply sad."
Skoler added: "Our aim, as always, is to provide the public with fact-based, un3 reporting and hold public officials accountable for their actions.
"As part of our process, we reached out to Representative Johnson numerous times over the course of a seven-month investigation.
"He declined requests to talk about our findings."
Kentucky Republican Gov.
Matt Bevin wrote on Twitter: "Saddened to hear of tonight's death of KY Representative Dan Johnson.
"My heart breaks for his family tonight ...
These are heavy days in Frankfort and in America ... May God indeed shed His grace on us all ... We sure need it..."
